meanings.sent1: Gravimetry helps scientists understand how strong gravity is in different places.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use gravimetry to measure the pull of gravity on objects.
meanings.sent3: During the gravimetry experiment, the scale got so heavy that it started to shake!
meanings.sent4: In the world of gravimetry, gravity is like a silent force that guides our movements.
meanings.sent5: The concept of gravimetry can be as heavy as a mountain, yet as light as a feather in understanding.

meanings.definition: The study of variations in gravitational fields.
meanings.sent1: Through gravimetry, researchers explore how gravity changes from one place to another.
meanings.sent2: Gravimetry helps us understand why gravity is stronger in some regions than in others.
meanings.sent3: The professor's gravimetry class was so interesting that even gravity seemed to be paying attention!
meanings.sent4: In the vast universe, gravimetry unveils the hidden dance of gravity across space and time.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of gravimetry lies in its ability to reveal the invisible threads that hold the cosmos together.

meanings.definition: The use of instruments to measure gravitational acceleration.
meanings.sent1: With gravimetry tools, scientists can calculate how fast objects fall due to gravity.
meanings.sent2: Gravimetry instruments help us determine the rate at which gravity pulls objects downward.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the gravimetry device beeped happily as it recorded the acceleration of gravity.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of gravimetry, instruments become the eyes that see the invisible force of gravity in action.
meanings.sent5: The precision of gravimetry instruments is like a skilled artist capturing the delicate movements of gravity.
